p: Several medicinal plants contain in their biochemical constitution many compounds with antibacterial action, that remains unknown [ 1]. Zingiber zerumbet (L.) Smith, a rhizomatous herbaceous species, belonging to the family Zingiberaceae, is a native plant from Southeast Asia with potential antimicrobial activity not fully comprehended [ 2]. In Brazil, this species is usually identified as bitter ginger and is easily found in large numbers in the Amazonas state, where it is well adapted to the local climatic conditions.
